page.title: 15Ancient Churches and Plague
page.content:
The{Anglican church}in{West Kingsdown sits in the middle of a heavily wooded area, some distance from the nearest houses. It is part{Norman}and clearly pre-dates all the housing for miles around. The major housing areas within the village are all a way removed from the church.
This feature is not uncommon in villages in this part of Kent (see Fawkham and Hartley to the north). It is attributed to the effects of the {Black Death}or{plague,}wiping out the original village clustered round the church. Where houses were unaffected they were generally some way from the church and thus from other habitation. When the village started up again it was around those houses whose occupants had survived.
